markdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
# How to edit math equations in blog
### _Create web articles and blog posts with equations and diagrams_

This blog utilize the `remark-math` plugin for `ReactMarkdown` as the math equation finder. We can now use `$` to insert inline math equations and double dollar `$$` as block math equations.

## Math Equation

The plugin converts LaTeX equations in single-dollars `$`: for instance, `$ax^2+bx+c=0$` will render the equation $ax^2+bx+c=0$.

Also, we can render the root of the above equation as follows:
 
```
$$
x_{1,2} = {-b\pm\sqrt{b^2 - 4ac} \over 2a}.
$$
```

The code block will give us:
$$
x_{1,2} = {-b\pm\sqrt{b^2 - 4ac} \over 2a}.
$$

Noted that, the double-dollar sign will occupy the whole line.

$$
|\vec{A}|=\sqrt{A_x^2 + A_y^2 + A_z^2}.
$$

$$
\frac{\partial f(y)}{\partial x}
$$

It is possible to write Cyrillic symbols in `\text` command: $Q_\text{плавления}>0$.

One can use matrices:


$$T^{\mu\nu}=\begin{pmatrix}
\varepsilon&0&0&0\\
0&\varepsilon/3&0&0\\
0&0&\varepsilon/3&0\\
0&0&0&\varepsilon/3
\end{pmatrix},$$

integrals:

$$
P_\omega={n_\omega\over 2}\hbar\omega\,{1+R\over 1-v^2}\int\limits_{-1}^{1}dx\,(x-v)|x-v|,
$$
